00060 struct wtk_basic_frame {
00062         struct win_window                 *win;
00064         wtk_basic_frame_command_handler_t frame_handler;
00066         void                              *custom_data;
00068         wtk_basic_frame_draw_handler_t    draw_handler;

00115 static bool wtk_basic_frame_handler(struct win_window *win,
00116                 enum win_event_type type, const void *data)
00117 {
00118         // Custom data for windows of a widget points back to the widget itself.
00119         struct wtk_basic_frame *frame;
00120         bool should_destroy;
00121         struct win_clip_region const *clip;
00122 
00123         frame = win_get_custom_data(win);
00124 
00125         switch (type) {
00126         case WIN_EVENT_DRAW:
00127                 /* For DRAW events, the data parameter points to the
00128                  * clipping region.
00129                  */
00130                 clip = (struct win_clip_region const *)data;
00131 
00132                 if (win == frame->win) {
00133                         if (frame->draw_handler) {
00134                                 // Call the draw handler
00135                                 frame->draw_handler(win, clip);
00136                         }
00137                 }
00138                 /* Always accept DRAW events, as the return value is
00139                  * ignored anyway for that event type.
00140                  */
00141                 return true;
00142 
00143         case WIN_EVENT_POINTER:
00144                 /* Accept all POINTER events so that it does not
00145                  * propagate up the window tree to our parent in case
00146                  * we did not click anything useful inside the frame.
00147                  */
00148                 return true;
00149 
00150         case WIN_EVENT_DESTROY:
00151                 /* When the frame window is destroyed, also destroy
00152                  * the rest of the non-window frame allocations.
00153                  */
00154                 if (win == frame->win) {
00155                         /* Memory allocated for windows will be
00156                          * automatically destroyed by the window
00157                          * system. We must destroy other allocations.
00158                          */
00159                         membag_free(frame);
00160                 }
00161 
00162                 /* Always accept DESTROY events, as the return value is
00163                  * ignored anyway for that event type.
00164                  */
00165                 return true;
00166 
00167         case WIN_EVENT_COMMAND:
00168                 /* When commands are received either directly or
00169                  * propagated from child widgets and windows, send it
00170                  * to the frame handler.
00171                  */
00172                 if (win == frame->win) {
00173                         if (frame->frame_handler) {
00174                                 /* If the frame handler returns true,
00175                                  * it wants us to destroy the frame.
00176                                  * This is normally used by CLOSE
00177                                  * buttons.
00178                                  */
00179                                 should_destroy = frame->frame_handler(frame,
00180                                                 (win_command_t)data);
00181 
00182                                 /* It is safe to destroy it here, since
00183                                  * the event handling finished right
00184                                  * after this handler returns, and no
00185                                  * other references to this frame or
00186                                  * its contents will be done.
00187                                  */
00188                                 if (should_destroy) {
00189                                         win_destroy(frame->win);
00190                                 }
00191 
00192                                 /* Accept the event if there was a
00193                                  * handler installed.
00194                                  */
00195                                 return true;
00196                         }
00197                 }
00198 
00199                 /* Reject the event if there was no handler, or this
00200                  * was not the container window at all.
00201                  */
00202                 return false;
00203 
00204         default:
00205                 // Reject unknown event types.
00206                 return false;
00207 
00208         }
00209 }

00236 struct wtk_basic_frame *wtk_basic_frame_create(struct win_window *parent,
00237                 const struct win_area *area, struct gfx_bitmap *background,
00238                 wtk_basic_frame_draw_handler_t draw_handler,
00239                 wtk_basic_frame_command_handler_t frame_handler, void *custom_data)
00240 {
00241         struct win_attributes   attr;
00242         struct wtk_basic_frame  *basic_frame;
00243 
00244         assert(area);
00245         assert(parent);
00246 
00247         // Allocate memory for frame control data.
00248         basic_frame = membag_alloc(sizeof(struct wtk_basic_frame));
00249         if (!basic_frame) {
00250                 goto outofmem_basic_frame;
00251         }
00252 
00253         // Set window attributes
00254         basic_frame->frame_handler = frame_handler;
00255         basic_frame->custom_data = custom_data;
00256         basic_frame->draw_handler = draw_handler;
00257 
00258         // Copy area info
00259         attr.area = *area;
00260         attr.event_handler = wtk_basic_frame_handler;
00261         attr.custom = basic_frame;
00262 
00263         // Set background for window
00264         if (background) {
00265                 attr.background = background;
00266                 attr.behavior = 0;
00267         } else {
00268                 attr.background = NULL;
00269                 attr.behavior = WIN_BEHAVIOR_REDRAW_PARENT;
00270         }
00271 
00272         // Create the window
00273         basic_frame->win = win_create(parent, &attr);
00274         if (!basic_frame->win) {
00275                 goto outofmem_win;
00276         }
00277 
00278         return basic_frame;
00279 
00280 outofmem_win:
00281         membag_free(basic_frame);
00282 
00283 outofmem_basic_frame:
00284         return NULL;
00285 }
